column4: can someone help me out with secure ssh tunneling and VNC? I've done it before but it just doesn't seem to work now...I remember getting it right was a pain last time.
Put this in your ~/.ssh/config
oh, wait, you want putty?
yeah
I've done it before -- and I think it's right, but obviously it's not because it isn't working :-p
so.. this situation:
You're on a windows box, and want to VNC over SSH to a linux machine
correct
Fairly easy, you want to do a "Source Port" 5900
then Destination localhost:5900
then click add
then connect

I have source to 5900 and remote to 5901. then I open vnc and then click connect then localhost. it connects and nothing comes up. If I close my putty window it kills the vnc connection, so I think it's on the other side
well, source is the local port on the windows PC
so if you have a VNC server on the windows PC you can't use 5900
VNC server is running on a ubuntu machine
Ok, but what about the windows machine?
is there a server there too?
the windows machine is using a vnc client.  Do you know how to tell in ubuntu what port vnc is listening on?
netstat -aepl | grep vnc
that might work
netstat -pl | grep vnc
http://img373.imageshack.us/my.php?image=vncpk5.jpg <-- does that look right to you? it does me
